linear algebra: help functions¶

CSR matrix class¶

class src.csrmatrix.csr_matrix(csrTuple, shape=None)[source]¶

Compressed Sparse Row matrix.

This can be instantiated via:

csr_matrix((data, indices, indptr), [shape = (m,n)])

data¶

CSR format data array of the matrix.

Type

list

indices¶

CSR formmat indices array of the matrix.

Type

list

indptr¶

CSR format index pointer array of the matrix.

Type

list

shape¶

Shape (/dimension) of the matrix, optional.

Type

2-tuple

Functions

__add__(B)[source]¶

Sum of two matrices A and B.

Operator : + / -

Parameters

  • A (csr_matrix) -- Contains lists of data, indices, indptr as well as tuple (m,n) shape of matrix.

  • B (csr_matrix) -- Contains lists of data, indices, indptr as well as tuple (m,n) shape of matrix.

Returns

csrAplusB -- A+B in CSR format.

Return type

csr_matrix

Code¶

CSR matrix class:¶
  1class csr_matrix:
  2    """Compressed Sparse Row matrix.
  3
  4    This can  be instantiated via:
  5        csr_matrix((data, indices, indptr), [shape = (m,n)])
  6
  7    Attributes
  8    ----------
  9
 10    data : list
 11        CSR format data array of the matrix.
 12    indices : list
 13        CSR formmat indices array of the matrix.
 14    indptr : list
 15        CSR format index pointer array of the matrix.
 16    shape : 2-tuple
 17        Shape (/dimension) of the matrix, optional.
 18
 19
 20    Functions
 21
 22    """
 23
 24    def __init__(self, csrTuple, shape=None):
 25        _data, _indices, _indptr = csrTuple
 26        if shape:
 27            self.shape = shape
 28        self.data = _data
 29        self.indices = _indices
 30        self.indptr = _indptr
 31
 32    def toarray(self):
 33        """CSR matrix array.
 34
 35        Function arrays full matrix based on csr_matrix.
 36
 37        Parameters
 38        ----------
 39        A : csr_matrix
 40            Contains lists of data, indices, indptr as well as tuple (m,n) shape of matrix.
 41
 42        Returns
 43        -------
 44        rows : list
 45            Contains list of each row.
 46
 47        """
 48        m = self.shape[0]  # rows
 49        n = self.shape[1]  # columns
 50        rows = []  # gap for rows
 51        for i in range(m):  # in order to create list for each row
 52            row_helper = [0] * n
 53            for l in range(self.indptr[i], self.indptr[i + 1]):  # adjacency pairs from list indptr (Adjanzenzpaare)
 54                row_helper[self.indices[l]] = self.data[l]  # zeros in row_helper replaced by data
 55            rows = rows + [row_helper]
 56        return rows
 57
 58    def __matmul__(self, b):
 59        """Matrix-vector product.
 60
 61        Operator : @
 62
 63        Parameters
 64        ----------
 65        A : csr_matrix
 66            Matrix in CSR format.
 67        b : list
 68            Vector.
 69
 70        Returns
 71        -------
 72        Amatmulb : list
 73            Resulting vector.
 74        """
 75        A = csr_matrix.toarray(self) # firstly builds full matrix
 76        # now A@b
 77        Amatmulb = []
 78        x = 0
 79        for i in A:  # A is list, i is list in A
 80            j = 0
 81            for l in i:  # for scalars of Amatmulb
 82                x = x + l * b[j]  # adds up scalars
 83                j = j + 1
 84            Amatmulb = Amatmulb + [x]
 85            x = 0  # reset for next row
 86        return Amatmulb
 87
 88    def __add__(self, B):
 89        """Sum of two matrices A and B.
 90
 91        Operator : + / -
 92
 93        Parameters
 94        ----------
 95        A : csr_matrix
 96            Contains lists of data, indices, indptr as well as tuple (m,n) shape of matrix.
 97        B : csr_matrix
 98            Contains lists of data, indices, indptr as well as tuple (m,n) shape of matrix.
 99
100        Returns
101        -------
102        csrAplusB : csr_matrix
103            A+B in CSR format.
104        """
105        Aar = csr_matrix.toarray(self)
106        x = len(Aar)
107        Bar = csr_matrix.toarray(B)
108        AplusB = []
109        for i in Aar:  # i is list/ row of Aar
110            k = Bar[Aar.index(i)]  # k is list/ row of Bar
111            row_helper = []
112            for j in range(x):
113                row_helper = row_helper + [i[j] + k[j]]  # adds scalars of rows
114            AplusB = AplusB + [row_helper]
115
116       #now back to CSR format
117        data = []
118        indices = []
119        indptr = [0]
120        ptrcount = 0
121        for row in AplusB:
122            m = len(row)        #for shape
123            for j in row:
124                if j != 0:
125                    data = data + [j]
126                    indices = indices + [row.index(j)]
127                    ptrcount = ptrcount+1
128            indptr = indptr + [ptrcount]
129        n = len(AplusB)
130        shape = (m, n)
131        csrAplusB = csr_matrix((data, indices, indptr),shape)
132        return csrAplusB
Tridiagonal Toeplitz Matrix:¶
 1from src import csrmatrix as csr
 2
 3def tridiagtoep(n, toepdata):
 4    """Tridiagonal Toeplitz matrix.
 5
 6    Parameters
 7    ----------
 8    n : int
 9        Shape of matrix will be (n,n).
10    toepdata : list
11        Supposed to contain 3 elements; data = [value on diagonal, upper value, under value].
12
13    Returns
14    -------
15    toeplitz : csr_matrix
16        Instantiated CSR matrix.
17
18    """
19    data = toepdata * (n - 1) + [toepdata[0]]
20
21    indptr = [0, 2]  # 2 elements in first row
22    x = 2
23    for i in range(n - 2):
24        x = x + 3  # 3 elements in middle rows
25        indptr = indptr + [x]
26    indptr = indptr + [x + 2]  # 2 elements in last row
27
28    indices = [0, 1]  # first row indices
29    for i in range(n - 2):  # middle row indices
30        indices = indices + [i, i + 1, i + 2]
31    indices = indices + [n - 2, n-1]  # last row indices
32
33    toeplitz = csr.csr_matrix((data, indices, indptr), (n, n))
34    return toeplitz
Unit Matrix¶
 1from src import csrmatrix as csr
 2
 3def I(n, delta=1):
 4    """
 5    Unit matrix I.
 6
 7    Parameters
 8    ----------
 9    n : int
10        Dimension of unit matrix.
11    delta: int or float, optional
12        Factor for scalar multiplication. The default is 1.
13
14    Returns
15    -------
16    I : csr_matrix
17        Unit matrix in CSR format.
18
19    """
20    I_data = []
21    I_index = []
22    I_indptr = [0]
23    n = int(n)  # int zum iterieren
24
25    for i in range(n):
26        I_data.append(delta)
27        I_index.append(i)
28        I_indptr.append(i + 1)
29
30    I = csr.csr_matrix((I_data, I_index, I_indptr), (n, n))
31    return I
Vectors:¶
  1def vector(scalar1, scalar2, *scalars):
  2    """Vector instantiation.
  3
  4    Builds vector v=(v1, v2, ...)T based on given scalars.
  5
  6    Parameters
  7    ----------
  8    scalar1 : float/ int
  9        Scalar v1.
 10    scalar2 : float/ int
 11        Scalar v2.
 12    *scalars : float/ int
 13        Any other scalars v3, v4,...
 14
 15    Returns
 16    -------
 17    vector : list
 18        Scalars are elements of this list.
 19
 20    """
 21    vector = [scalar1, scalar2, *scalars]
 22    return vector
 23
 24def vecdim(vector):
 25    """Dimension of given vector.
 26
 27    Parameters
 28    ----------
 29    vector : list
 30        Given vector.
 31
 32    Returns
 33    -------
 34    len(vector): int
 35        Number of elements/scalars of vector.
 36
 37    """
 38    return len(vector)
 39
 40def scal(alpha, x):
 41    """Scalar multiplication.
 42
 43    Vector x multiplied by alpha.
 44
 45    Parameters
 46    ----------
 47    alpha : float
 48        Scalar.
 49    x : list
 50        vector.
 51
 52    Returns
 53    -------
 54    scalvec : list
 55        Vector.
 56
 57    """
 58    scalvec = []
 59    for i in x:
 60        productia = i * alpha
 61        scalvec.append(productia)
 62    return scalvec
 63
 64
 65def axpy(x, y, alpha=1.):
 66    """Addition of vectors.
 67
 68    Parameters
 69    ----------
 70    x : list
 71        Vector.
 72    y : list
 73        Vector.
 74    alpha : float/ int, optional
 75        For scalar multiplicaton: vector x multplied by alpha. The default is 1..
 76
 77    Returns
 78    -------
 79    addvec : list
 80        Vector.
 81
 82    """
 83    alphax = []
 84    for i in x:  # scalar multiplication of x by alpha
 85        productia = i * alpha
 86        alphax.append(productia)
 87
 88    addvec = []
 89    for i in range(len(y)):
 90        sumi = alphax[i] + y[i]  # adds scalars of alpha x and y from same position/ index
 91        addvec.append(sumi)
 92    return addvec
 93
 94
 95def nrm(x):
 96    """Euclid norm of a vector.
 97
 98    Parameters
 99    ----------
100    x : list
101        Vector.
102
103    Returns
104    -------
105    normx : float
106        Euclid norm.
107
108    """
109    quad = []
110    for i in x:
111        quad = quad + [i**2]       #in square root
112    norm = sum(quad) ** 0.5
113    return norm
114
115
116
117def csrmv(A, x):            #similar to __matmul__ in class csr_matrix
118    """
119    Matrix-vector product.
120
121    Parameters
122    ----------
123    A : csr_matrix
124        Matrix in CSR format.
125    x : list
126        Vector.
127
128    Returns
129    -------
130    mvp : list
131        Vector Ax.
132    """
133    m = A.shape[0]    #like toarray in class csr-matrix
134    n = A.shape[1]
135    rows = []
136    for i in range(m):
137        row_helper = [0]*n
138        for l in range(A.indptr[i], A.indptr[i+1]):
139            row_helper[A.indices[l]] = A.data[l]
140        rows = rows + [row_helper]
141
142    mvp = []        #matrix vector product
143    y = 0
144    for i in rows:
145        j = 0
146        for l in i:
147            y = y + l* x[j]
148            j = j + 1
149        mvp = mvp + [y]
150        y = 0
151    return mvp
